headline: Energy Secretary Granholm Violated STOCK Act 9 Times In 2021, Spox Blames ‘Clerical Error’
author: Michael Ginsberg
sentences:
“This was an inadvertent clerical oversight on reporting stock sales that ethics officials previously determined did not pose a conflict
Comments:
So, when she's not laughing and being sarcastic about skyrocketing gasoline prices, she's committing crimes.
Secretary of Energy Jennifer Granholm blamed a “clerical error” for serial violations of the law that governs the reporting of securities transactions, according to Insider.
The secretary filed two reports with the Office of Government Ethics on Dec. 15 and 16 detailing nine stock transactions that she conducted between April 30 and Oct. 26.
All nine transactions fall outside the 45 day window that the STOCK Act mandates government officials report their trades within, according to Insider.
Granholm violated the STOCK Act nine times in 2021, Insider first reported Thursday.
Our government officials in action, and we're paying her handsomely as well.
